question: What is the mechanism of action of magrolimab?
ideal_answer: Magrolimab is an anti-CD47 antibody with promising results for myelodysplastic syndromes and acute myeloid leukemia.

snippets.text: Magrolimab, an anti-CD47 antibody, has shown proof-of-principle of efficacy in this therapeutic class with promising early results in both higher risk myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS) and TP53 mutant acute myeloid leukemia (AML).
In addition, initial clinical data of CD47 targeting in AML/MDS will be reviewed, and including the first-in-class anti-CD47 antibody magrolimab.
